website_summaries.verdict: Nice cold weather batting glove option that's designed to reduce sting.
pros: Includes extra padding to absorb impact and reduce sting of mishits, especially in cold weather
Padding doesn't inhibit ability to move the hands easily, though
Able to pick among 6 different color combinations and 9 different sizes
cons: may not last through the entire season

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Quality
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved these gloves. She said they fit great and they helped reduce the sting on her hitting. The problem was the durability. I purchased these in March. By early June they were completely tore up from I'd say about 30 hours total of just regular batting use. Sure my kid plays a lot of ball, but 3 months? Come on. Fortunately they're not too expensive so replacing is not too big of a deal. But I thought Franklin was supposed to be high quality. I guess not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes, items are on sale for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Franklin batting gloves before along with Nike and UA. Usually, they are high quality. I've had some pairs last me years before. I bought these to go with a new hat, pants, bat and socks for playing recreational softball as I'm playing again for the first time in many years. Literally, 2 games into the season and the stitching around the 'Shok-Sorb' padding is coming undone in 4 different spots already. I repeat, 2 games of recreational softball. Guess I know why they were on sale. These gloves won't even last half a season playing one night a week.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a huge fan of Franklin sporting gear but ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of Franklin sporting gear but the one thing that bears the Franklin name that I don't hesitate to buy are their batting gloves. I bought these for my son at the beginning of baseball season and they lasted the entire school season as well as the entire summer. My son plays somewhere in the neighborhood of 50+ games over the summer and he wore the same batting gloves every game. The glove can get a little stiff when thrown in the bottom of a baseball bag but what gloves wouldn't? I'll buy another pair when these finally give out.
customer_reviews.author: Adams, NY

customer_reviews.title: Stitching issues but would still recommend
customer_reviews.text: 10/2016: Gloves have great padding and comfortable fit but item arrived with poor stitching on the palms. 2/2019 update: despite stitching being poor, gloves held up well and I’m still using them for softball (3 seasons per year). Going to buy another pair now, anticipating these won’t last another season. Adult male 5’10 180lbs - adult large fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Maybe fake?
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Franklin gloves before and always found them well built and durable. These came with thread already fraying before use and then tore my first visit to the batting cages. They also had some off printed words on them that I haven't seen on Franklins. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Rushing

customer_reviews.title: Palm stitching coming out
customer_reviews.text: The stitching on the palm started coming apart in less than a week. The unraveling has slowed and my son will keep them as a backup glove.
customer_reviews.author: mn mom

customer_reviews.title: Sleek looking, but pointer fingers are internally stitched very poorly
customer_reviews.text: The inside stitching of the pointer finger is haphazardly placed right along where the outside of the fingernail meets the finger - this creates a significant rub/agitation point with prolonged use. I cut the stitching back but did not have much success. It would probably cost more, but fixing this problem would result in a really good glove.
customer_reviews.author: jwal

customer_reviews.title: Fits pretty well, and the bat grip is really good
customer_reviews.text: Fits pretty well, and the bat grip is really good, being using it for a few days without any complaints, although im little scare because they seem to be fragile and won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: tjbelliardd

customer_reviews.title: These gloves have been a good fit and have held up well through the first ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have been a good fit and have held up well through the first few games of the season. Make sure to use the hand sizing chart to get a good idea of the proper fit. My hands are only about 7" long at the tip of the middle finger but are pretty wide and a Medium size fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Daring Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good padding, no stinging!
customer_reviews.text: My little contact hitter was having trouble with a particularly bad USA Bat, which I won't mention but rhymes with "Boast Hex Diaperlite." The Shok-Sorb pads on these are really good - nice gloves. Also, Solo 618, way better.
customer_reviews.author: The Burgermuffin

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: My batting improved the first time I wore these. Very comfortable. Did take sting away and helped hand from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Mark RoBards

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Not for golf. In case you were wondering. These truly cut down on the callouses that I'd get from long bouts in the cage with some nifty padding lining parts of the palm of the glove. Franklin is so 90s for baseball and the nostalgia didn't dissapoint.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: split out at seams with little use. No way could glove take the rigors of a full season.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Best glove for performance and feeling..
customer_reviews.text: I am 51 and use these in our mens baseball league. The pads around the thumb and throughout the glove are the best that I have found on Amazon. Great for cold weather (Spring in Vermont) and they held up during our 18 game season. I would recommend these for anyone who gets that "stinging" or hard vibrations from a bat.
customer_reviews.author: James fournier

customer_reviews.title: He says these gloves are significantly better than the gloves he previously wore in minimizes bat ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 11 yr old son as he would complain about the bat stings when were would go to bating cages. He says these gloves are significantly better than the gloves he previously wore in minimizes bat stings.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Wilson

customer_reviews.title: but they look good, feel good
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of batting gloves, so I can't speak from a point of experience, but they look good, feel good. These gloves are not a perfect solution to batting all day, but I don't think any gloves would do that.
customer_reviews.author: Will A.

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my son because he was starting to get a blister from batting and they have worked great! He loves them and I’m happy that they were reasonably priced and have worked great for his needs.
customer_reviews.author: Wvgrl525

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable grip
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves. The shok-absorb padding on the inside makes it really easy to get a comfortable grip. The only knock on these I have is that they start to tear a little earlier than my previous gloves. You will probably need to buy a pair for each regular season.
customer_reviews.author: Mk

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and feel.
customer_reviews.text: While these gloves fit and worked well, the velcro did not stay good thru the first season and they started coming apart at the seams at the end of the first season as well. I will not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Beeson

customer_reviews.title: Lines are perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I will only buy gloves similar to these going forward. The lines on the knuckles line to to show you where and how to adjust your grip on the bat. This is an invaluable and little known feature to most kids, parents. Grip the bat properly and your elbows will automatically fall into place.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley D. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of no-frills batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price and I wore these all season, including underneath my catchers mitt, and they held up well. Excellent pair of inexpensive batting gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Burke Tagney

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves with extra padding
customer_reviews.text: Giving my grandson a pair of the Franklin Sports MLB Shok-Sorb Neo Batting Gloves gave him more confidence when at bat, knowing that he was not going to feel the sting when the metal bat hit the ball in machine pitch.
customer_reviews.author: LReed

customer_reviews.title: My daughter says that the really help, especially early ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter says that the really help, especially early in the season when it is still cold out, purchased a pair several years ago, they held up well, but finally ripped
customer_reviews.author: cliff

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection and Durability
customer_reviews.text: Got these because I had some serious blisters from hitting and they provided reinforcement on the palms. They offer great protectection and have withstood thousands of swings so far, very durable gloves as long as they don't dry out from sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P.

customer_reviews.title: Not using as a batting glove
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these batting gloves to use as a casting glove for fishing. I have used various brands of batting gloves for this purpose for over 10 years. Most last a season due to the type of line I am using (braid). Lately, I have found that most batting gloves do not have leather palms, these glove do. I have tried them and found them to be comfortable and durable and plan to purchase more gloves in future.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: initially ordered the Large and it was way too snug. returned and got the XL because i loved the glove quality and feel just not the fit. the XL is still a bit snug but manageable. the glove itself is amazing. looks great, the leather is soft and it really does absorb vibrations very well allowing for smooth hitting.
customer_reviews.author: mrnd23

customer_reviews.title: Glad to own, then not
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and comfort. These are exactly as advertised. ****REVISED**** Used once at batting cage and ripped up to shreds.
customer_reviews.author: Another Critic

customer_reviews.title: My 8yr son really liked
customer_reviews.text: They took the sting off his hands. He was playing with unpadded WR gloves and these were a big upgrade in comfort, doesn't complain anymore
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as a surprise gift for his upcoming men's softball season. I was afraid I ordered the wrong size at first but when he tried them on, they were a perfect fit! The padding is perfect per him because he wears one glove under his baseball glove when he's in the outfield. Will be purchasing these again if he needs a replacement pair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feel and look awesome. I am Mike Trout now ;)
customer_reviews.text: I am a thin build and the medium size fits nice and snug. it makes the bat feel a lot lighter. seems like a great deal considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Find something else!
customer_reviews.text: Completely fell apart. Day and a half of batting practice....
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Amezcua

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These are durable gloves and the colors are cool. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Y.

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy again
customer_reviews.text: Seem to work as advertised. He’ll still feel vibration but it lessens it. Nice looking and decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the gloves looked perfect and the other one wasn't stitched properly on the little finger (hole). They are comfortable but I'll have to see about the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: I am a medium and It’s good fitting for my Palm. The stitches tend to come off rather sooner than expected
customer_reviews.author: Rajan Shankar

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion
customer_reviews.text: It's my daughter's first season playing softball and the padding on these are perfect.

customer_reviews.title: No tengo mi pedido
customer_reviews.text: I bought some baseball gloves and never received my order, what steps should I take to make a claim? Dice que posiblemente llegó mi pedido pero jamás lo recibí por donde reclamo?
customer_reviews.author: Mauryana

customer_reviews.title: Great value for ur buck
customer_reviews.text: Great value for ur buck. Good padding although I once owned some similar gloves same brand with more padding but these will do fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old says he feels the sting sometime. But not as much as with his regular gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its exactly what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: They dont sell a lot of the shock gloves in store. Hard to come by but exactly what i needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good set of batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good set of batting gloves. I’d buy them again. Not as much padding as I expected based on the name but still more padding than some of the basic gloves at Big 5.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Franklin batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Franklin batting gloves work well and have lasted through a very hot and sweaty practice season. Add to bat control and reduce any vibration due to hitting off handle.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these with 60mph pitches and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit for a 12yo and in great shape
customer_reviews.text: Youth large, perfect fit for a 12yo and in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: theunartistTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Quality is suspect.
customer_reviews.text: Stiching has come out around the fingers, on the inside. This was after one game, of use.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy W. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Used to be my choice of batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Worn one game. Swung and right hand glove split right down the middle. Trashed the gloves right at the field. Paying all these athletes to endorse their product that their quality has sunk. Sad
customer_reviews.author: L.Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Sports MLB Shok-Sorb Neo Batting Gloves (Pair)
customer_reviews.text: Simply I love them! love the colours, finish, good quality!

customer_reviews.title: Weird colors, but gets the job done well.
customer_reviews.text: Wonkey colors, but they fit well, are comfortable, have ample padding in the palm and breathable fabric on the back of the hand. Would recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Super soft material. not itchy. Easy on and off. Son really likes them.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Very comfortable. It has some extra padding right where you need it. They hold up well when sliding into or back to base. They've lasted longer than most.

customer_reviews.title: A bit snug but good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the XLs and they fit a bit snug...however they are still a decent buy and will stretch with use. I was a little disappointed with the thickness of the material. It felt a bit thin even for paying $19. Bottom line...they work and were as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little big
customer_reviews.text: So far gloves work and lasted a season. They look good as well but they are a little loose fitting for the size.

customer_reviews.title: B-ball
customer_reviews.text: Not really any dislikes, my son feels they help. The only issue is that the child's large was too small and the adult's small are too big, but he's using them anyways and has growing room, as long as they last that long.?

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable padded gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 13yr old son. Great gloves for BP.

customer_reviews.title: Nice batting gloves.
customer_reviews.text: love this batting gloves. Feels nice in the hand while batting.

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: Good hands protection and very durable!
customer_reviews.text: My Son takes batting practice almost every day, takes about 1000 swings a day. Good hand protection and very durable. Just bought second pair. Last pair were good for 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Laureano Lopez

customer_reviews.title: SO-SO GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: They fit pretty good. The down side is black dye in the leather keeps coming off on my hand after I wear them. So I stopped wearing them. I have other Franklin gloves that do not do that.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Time will tell how well they hold up to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Best glove for protecting hands from vibration
customer_reviews.text: I tried many gloves and found this one for my son when he was 8. He is 13 now and has been using this glove ever since. It is great if you have a bat that stings when you have a miss hit or when it is cold outside.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Villella

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates the aftershock of the bat
customer_reviews.text: I love the gloves. I use them for slow-pitch softball and it has completely eliminated the aftershock effect of making a hit.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Batting Gloves

customer_reviews.title: Stitching came undone on Velcro strap...Poorly made

customer_reviews.title: Glove Performs Well
customer_reviews.text: Solid glove but I expected a bit more padding similar to the same product ordered previously. Still it is working great as a batting practice glove.

customer_reviews.title: Beast batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Never going back to Eastons, Mizunos or any other batting gloves. You really feel the comfort and the high quality of these gloves.

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Really great value. Holding up very well through 1st season of 2 softball leagues.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports MLB Shok-Sorb Neo Batting Gloves (Pair)
feature_bullets: Shok-sorb palm padding system absorbs impact and eliminates the "sting"
Tri-curve technology provides for a perfect fit
The ideal “all-around” glove that provides sting reduction while maintaining superior grip in all weather conditions
Comfortable fit along with strategically-placed flex points for a non-restrictive performance
